column4: I'm having trouble in Grub after I restored the files on my computer
How do I fix Grub in 8.10 without wiping affecting the other files I restored?
Fix in what way?
Which version of the liveCD?
ok this is the standard way to restore grub: http://pastebin.ubuntu.com/360722/
you were using grub as the primary bootloader right?
and 8.10 is still installed somewhere (although unable to boot at the moment)?
Will this overwrite everything I just restored?
it may be that the secondary stages of the bootloader has changed position on the disk, hence the mbr points to the wrong direction. These command will only overwrite the 466bytes of the mbr.
response is (hd0,0)
then use that in the "root.."  command
Thank you.  I will now reboot to see if that works.
good luck!
stage1 is in fact the data which is placed in the mbr (note that stage1 is only 512bytes = the size of the mbr)
It didn't work.
still the same error?
hmm, then I'm unsure, sorry.
What is the name of the file it's supposed to look for?
I think the grub mbr looks for the /boot/grub/stage2 file for further loading of grub..
What does stage1 do?
I don't know, but to restore them the best way would probably be reinstalling grub.
How do I do that?
first mount sda1 as /media/something , and then run the grub-install with --root-directory=/media/something and /dev/sda as the "mbr location"
